page.title: 04Life of a Powburn shepherd
page.content: My dad is a shepherd near Powburn.He looks after a flock of 640 ewes, 400 ewe lambs and l5 tups. The ewes are mules, the lambs are mules and the tups are Suffolks. The busiest time of the year is lambing time in April. This year lambing began on 28th March. In the lambing season my dad gets up early in the morning. Sometimes he has to stay up all night.The dipping is in June and September for sheep scab and ticks. Sales start in September.Quite a lot of work is involved.Lambs have to be brought in from the fields and sorted out.The fatter 'wether' lambs and the bestfrom the ewe lambs are sent to the breeding sales.Dressing sheep is for the breeding sales or for showing. The ewe is clipped around the face and neck to get rid of the 'clarts'.
